channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Verges recently cut and trimmed grass cutting blown onto private driveways and into road, 12th June
item.description:
Our idilic tree lined avenue in what is reported to be a respectable London suburb is becoming unloved and uncared for. Please include street cleaning in the process which involves making a mess. If I deposit debris in the street it would be deemed a criminal offence and I would be punished. Please explain why the contractor is allowed to get away with this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodside Avenue, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 12th June
item.description:
This vehicle has been left on our street for an extended period of time, and has not been moved. It does not appear to belong to anyone on the street, so would be grateful if it could be moved as parking is very scarce.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface has disintegrated, 12th June
item.description:
The road surface has broken up allowing huge cracks and divots to form. Cars drivers and cyclists are swerving to miss the worst areas and pedestrians are at risk of tripping/falling when crossing the road. This represents a serious safety issue to all users and must be addressed immediately before there is an accident. This issue was initially reported in March yet no action has been taken.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 109, Burnt Oak Lane, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
